poem:
Title: The Courtroom's Verdict

A ruby red apple, rotted
Bannon bears the verdict,
Contempt echoed in court chambers.
Trump's whispers stilled—
as justice unfurls, a green leaf,
under the watchful eyes of January's chill.
Circuit court crunches its teeth,
a three-judge gavel's beat.
Closer, the four-month sentence stands,
A hard-right's fall in these tender hands.
